greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: The largest prime that divides the n-th multiply perfect number: a(n) = A006530(A007691(n)); a(1) = 1.
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1600
mathematica: Map[FactorInteger[#][[-1, 1]] &, Select[Range[10^6], IntegerQ@ DivisorSigma[-1, #] &] ] (* or, using the b-file at A007691: *)
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Mar 19 2021
